term.title: selectively labelled

item.text: An isotopically labelled compound is designated as selectively labelled when a mixture of isotopically substituted compounds is formally added to the analogous isotopically unmodified compound in such a way that the position(s) but not necessarily the number of each labellingnuclide is defined. A selectively labelled compound may be considered as a mixture of specifically labelled compounds.

sources.item: PAC, 1981, 53, 1887. 'Nomenclature of inorganic chemistry: II.1 - Isotopically modified compounds' on page 1893 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198153101887)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
